data.title: key-value store
data.statement:
In this puzzle,  your task is to implement a key-value  store  that supports the following commands:

➤<<SET>> key1=value1 key2=value2 ...
 Create a new <<key>> or <<update>>  the value if the key already exists.
 Nothing to print.

➤<<GET>> key1 key2 ...
Print the corresponding value for each key, or {{null}} if it doesn't exist.

➤<<EXISTS>> key1 key2 ...
Print {{true}} or {{false}} for each key, depending on whether it exists.

➤<<KEYS>>
Print all stored <<keys>> in the <<same order>>  they were first set  or print {{EMPTY}} if no keys are present

Output should be space-separated for <<GET>>, <<EXISTS>> and <<KEYS>>.

testCases.title: OS INFO
testCases.testIn:
3
SET os-name=windows
SET os-arch=x64
GET os-name os-arch

testCases.title: OS INFO-Validator
testCases.testIn:
3
SET os-name=linux
SET os-arch=x32
GET os-name os-arch

testCases.title: ABCD
testCases.testIn:
3
SET A=A B=B C=C D=D
KEYS
GET A B C D
testCases.testOut:
A B C D
A B C D

testCases.title: ABCD-Validator
testCases.testIn:
3
SET D=D C=C B=B A=A
KEYS
GET D C B A
testCases.testOut:
D C B A
D C B A

testCases.title: SET / UPDATE
testCases.testIn:
4
SET password=root password=admin
SET username=root username=admin
KEYS
GET username password

testCases.title: SET / UPDATE-Validator
testCases.testIn:
4
SET username=admin username=root
SET password=admin password=root
KEYS
GET username password

testCases.title: codin-game
testCases.testIn:
12
KEYS
SET c=c
SET o=o
SET d=d
SET i=i
SET n=n
SET -=-
SET g=g
SET a=a
SET m=m
SET e=e
GET c o d i n - g a m e
testCases.testOut:
EMPTY
c o d i n - g a m e

testCases.title: codin-game Validator
testCases.testIn:
12
KEYS
SET e=e
SET m=m
SET a=a
SET g=g
SET -=-
SET n=n
SET i=i
SET d=d
SET o=o
SET c=c
GET e m a g - n i d o c
testCases.testOut:
EMPTY
e m a g - n i d o c

testCases.title: NULL
testCases.testIn:
3
KEYS
GET A B C
KEYS

testCases.title: NULL-Validator
testCases.testIn:
3
KEYS
KEYS
GET A B C

testCases.title: All
testCases.testIn:
17
KEYS
SET x=10 y=20 z=30
SET y=200 w=40
GET q x y w z
EXISTS w y q x z
KEYS
SET q=q r=r s=s r=R s=S
GET R q S
EXISTS r s t
SET t=tree u=universe v=tree w=planet
GET u t v w m
EXISTS m u x
KEYS
SET x=XX y=YY z=ZZ x=XXX
GET y x z
EXISTS y x z
KEYS
testCases.testOut:
EMPTY
null 10 200 40 30
true true false true true
x y z w
null q null
true true false
universe tree tree planet null
false true true
x y z w q r s t u v
YY XXX ZZ
true true true
x y z w q r s t u v

testCases.title: All-Validator
testCases.testIn:
17
KEYS
SET x=10 y=20 z=30
SET y=200 w=40
GET q x y w z
EXISTS w y q x z
KEYS
SET q=q r=r s=s r=R s=S
GET R q S
EXISTS r s t
SET t=tree u=universe v=tree w=planet
GET u t v w m
EXISTS m u x
KEYS
SET x=XX y=YY z=ZZ x=XXX
GET y x z
EXISTS y x z
KEYS
testCases.testOut:
EMPTY
null 10 200 40 30
true true false true true
x y z w
null q null
true true false
universe tree tree planet null
false true true
x y z w q r s t u v
YY XXX ZZ
true true true
x y z w q r s t u v

data.constraints:
3 < [[N]]  < 30
Keys and values in [[S]] do not contain <<spaces>> or <<=>>
data.stubGenerator:
read N:int 
loop N read S:string(100)

write value1 value2 value3
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1>>: An integer [[N]]— the number of instructions.
<<Next [[N]] lines>>: Each line contains a single instruction [[S]].
data.outputDescription: Print the result of each command based on the rules above

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

In this puzzle, your task is to implement a key-value store that supports the following commands:

➤SET key1=value1 key2=value2 ...
Create a new key or update the value if the key already exists.
Nothing to print.

➤GET key1 key2 ...
Print the corresponding value for each key, or null if it doesn't exist.

➤EXISTS key1 key2 ...
Print true or false for each key, depending on whether it exists.

➤KEYS
Print all stored keys in the same order they were first set or print EMPTY if no keys are present

Output should be space-separated for GET, EXISTS and KEYS.
Input
Line 1: An integer N— the number of instructions.
Next N lines: Each line contains a single instruction S.
Output
Print the result of each command based on the rules above
Constraints
3 < N < 30
Keys and values in S do not contain spaces or =
Example
Input
3
SET os-name=windows
SET os-arch=x64
GET os-name os-arch
Output
windows x64
